newsitem.title: USA: National carlot beef trade weekly review - USDA.
newsitem.headline: National carlot beef trade weekly review - USDA.

text.p: Boxed beef traded steady to weak on mostly moderate demand and offerings, USDA said.
Retail and HRI demand started very light, with most items in wide price ranges early, but as the week progressed, demand improved for immediate and post-hliday needs.
Some of the price gains early in the trading period were lost and generally a weaker tone was noted by week's end.
Chuck and round cuts were some of the cuts that had very erratic price changes, but by the end of the week, these cuts stabilized and were trending lower.

Rib and loin cuts continued to traded uneven, Choice cuts were generally weak, while the Select product traded generally steady with firmer undertones noted during the trading period. Closely trimmed items traded steady to weak on light to moderate demand with the most pressure on the Choice cuts. Beef trimmings steady on mostly moderate demand and offerings.

Fed cattle and blended coarse ground items were steady to lower on light to moderate demand and mostly moderate offerings. Fed cattle grinds were under the most downward pressure, with light demand early for these particular items.

For the week - Select and Choice rib primal generally steady; Select and Choice chuck primal steady to 1.00 lower; Select and Choice round primal steady; Select and Choice loin primal steady to 1.00 lower; Closely trimmed items steady to 1.00 lower; Beef trimmings steady; Fed cattle and blended coarse ground items steady to 6.00 lower. The Estimated Composite of Boxed Beef Cutout values of Choice 1-3 550/700 carcasses Dn .07 at 105.36; 700/850 Dn 1.09 at 104.64; Select 1-3 550/700 carcasses Up .36 at 99.32; 700/850 Dn .51 at 98.29.

COW and BULL CARCASS, BONELESS PROCESSING BEEF, CUTTER COW CUTOUT The fresh lean boneless beef market rebounded early on good immediate grinding demand and light to moderate offerings. However, as the week progressed, demand declined and prices finished the trading period at lower levels. The lower lean percentage items moved at mostly firm prices on moderate demand.

The cow carcass market continued to trade steady on moderate demand and offerings. Additionally, interest on cow cuts was moderate as supplies remained light to moderate, resulting in firm price levels for most cuts.

The 100% lean items traded generally steady on moderate demand and light to moderate offerings. Utility carcasses steady; Cutter not established; 90% boneless beef 1.50-2.00 lower; 85% 2.50-8.00 lower; 75% higher; 65% 2.00 higher. The Cutter cow carcass gross cut-out value for Thursday, May 22, 1997 was estimated at 79.07 per cwt., down .43 from a week ago Friday.
